name: split-join
description: A VS Code extension for splitting and joining text, inspired by mini.splitjoin.

splitJoin.bracketPairs.description: Defines the types of brackets to use for finding the closest enclosing pair, regardless of priority. Each entry should be a two-character string, e.g. '()', '[]', '{}'.
splitJoin.bracketPairs.markdownDescription: Defines the types of brackets to use for finding the closest enclosing pair, regardless of priority. Each entry should be a two-character string, e.g. '()', '[]', '{}'.
splitJoin.bracketPairs.title: Bracket Pairs

splitJoin.delimiters.description: Characters to look for, in priority order, to split/join on. Each entry should be a single character string, e.g. ',' or ';'.
splitJoin.delimiters.markdownDescription: Characters to look for, in priority order, to split/join on. Each entry should be a single character string, e.g. ',' or ';'.
splitJoin.delimiters.title: Delimiters

splitJoin.maxScanLength.description: Maximum number of characters to scan when searching for bracket pairs. 0 means unlimited (whole file).
splitJoin.maxScanLength.title: Max Characters to Scan

splitJoin.bracketStyle.description: Controls the bracket style for split/join. Object mapping language ids to styles. Use '*' for default. Styles: 'allman', 'one-true-brace'.
splitJoin.bracketStyle.markdownDescription: Controls the bracket style for split/join. Object mapping language ids to styles. Use '*' for default. Styles: 'allman', 'one-true-brace'. Example: { "*": "one-true-brace", "csharp": "allman" }.
splitJoin.bracketStyle.title: Bracket Style

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
